Glastrier.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: A+ Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are fantastic in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame, and can sweep, support, or wall significant portions of the metagame. These Pokemon require less support than most others to be used effectively and have few flaws that can easily be overlooked when compared to their positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

sets.name: Chilling Dynamax Sweeper
sets.description:
• Glastrier's insane bulk, power, and Chilling Neigh make it a fearsome Dynamax sweeper, especially under Trick Room.

  • Icicle Spear breaks through Focus Sash and Disguise, making it the ideal STAB once Dynamax has run out. Icicle Crash deals more consistent damage outside of Dynamax, and can flinch foes under Trick Room or with Custap Berry.

  • Heavy Slam gives Glastrier access to the valuable Max Steelspike while Dynamaxed.

  • Endure can be useful when used with Custap Berry to give Glastrier one priority attack.

  • Glastrier becomes a far more deadly Pokemon when it has Trick Room support. Cresselia is the best choice for this, since it can use Lunar Dance to give Glastrier another chance to sweep through teams, and even let it Dynamax early. Mimikyu and Porygon2 are also good users of Trick Room.

Items

  • Weakness Policy pairs perfectly with Dynamax, giving Glastrier another way to sweep teams.

  • Custap Berry can make revenge killing Glastrier extra difficult when it's low on health, giving it one attack with higher priority.

  • Assault Vest makes Glastrier even more difficult to take down on the special side, and pairs especially well with Dynamax.

  • Lum Berry can be paired with Swords Dance to severly punish Yawn leads such as Hippowdon and Swampert, and also to worry less about common Will-O-Wisp users such as Rotom-W.

Spectrier.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

sets.name: Ghost Rider
sets.description:
• Spectrier serves as a fragile but potent offensive sweeper, utilizing a very easily spammed Shadow Ball STAB option, high Speed tier, and Grim Neigh to overwhelm defensively oriented teams.

  • Hyper Beam and Dark Pulse help Spectrier break through Normal-type Pokemon, and have the added bonus of dropping Speed and Special Defense, respectively, when Dynamaxed.

  • Will-O-Wisp and Mud Shot allow Spectrier to provide surprisingly good support for teammates, as opponents need to respect Spectrier's offensive capabilities, leaving them vulnerable the two crippling moves.

  • Substitute or Taunt are also great options for helping Spectrier take advantage of passive Pokemon, allowing it to setup Nasty Plot against unsuspecting foes.

Items

  • Life Orb maximizes Spectrier's power, and puts less pressure on it needing to set up Nasty Plot to sweep.

  • Spell Tag is a decent alternative if Life Orb is used by another Pokemon on your team.

  • Lum Berry gives Spectrier an alternate means to set up on more passive Pokemon, such as Hippowdon and Swampert.

EV Spreads

  • 36 Def / 252 SpA / 220 Spe Timid: Allows Spectrier to outspeed 252 EV invested neutral Dragapult while gaining a bit more physical bulk to take advantage of burned foes.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
• Spectrier runs a fairly simple Choice Scarf set, using its top Speed tier in order to revenge kill and snowball against opponents with its Grim Neigh boosts.

  • Hyper Beam is usually picked to increase damage output, but Uproar can also be opted for to avoid a turn cooldown when not Dynamaxed and avoid falling asleep.

  • Dark Pulse allows Spectrier to drop foes' Special Defense when Dynamaxed, Will-O-Wisp lets Spectrier serve as an emergency control against physical sweepers while also providing a Max Guard option, and Mud Shot allows Spectrier provide Speed control while also boosting its own Special Defense with Max Quake.
